messages.title: ANDREW'S PRIORITIES FOR ALTRINCHAM & SALE WEST
messages.content: Ending Tory Austerity, Your Say On Brexit, Properly Funding Our Schools, Tackling The Climate Emergency, More Police On Our Streets

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Andrew will oppose austerity and campaign to end rough sleeping and the need for foodbanks in Altrincham & Sale West.
Andrew supports Labour's plans for a People's Vote on EU membership and will vote for and campaign to remain in any second referendum.
Andrew will campaign for fairer funding so that schools in Trafford get a fair share of available resources.
Andrew supports Labour's plans for a Green New Deal to protect our environment and deliver a transformed green economy.
Andrew will campaign for more police on the streets so that residents in Altrincham & Sale West feel safe.

community.content: Andrew will oppose austerity and campaign to end rough sleeping and the need for foodbanks in Altrincham & Sale West.

leaflet.personalStatement: Andrew is a lifelong resident of Altrincham & Sale West. He grew up in Timperley, lives in Altrincham and has been a Sale Councillor since 2011. Since 2018 he has been the Leader of Trafford Council, fighting to protect local services in the face of continued Tory austerity. He also leads on the Green City Region for Greater Manchester. Andrew contested the 2017 General Election in Altrincham & Sale West more than halving the Tory majority. Active in the local community for the past 12 years, Andrew is Vice President of a local youth organisation and serves on the board of a local mental health charity. Before becoming Leader of the Council he worked for a civil engineering consultancy supporting national infrastructure projects. Andrew's policy interests include education, housing, climate change and policing.

personalStories.story: Andrew is a lifelong resident of Altrincham & Sale West. He grew up in Timperley, lives in Altrincham and has been a Sale Councillor since 2011. Active in the local community for the past 12 years, Andrew is Vice President of a local youth organisation and serves on the board of a local mental health charity. Before becoming Leader of the Council he worked for a civil engineering consultancy supporting national infrastructure projects.

examples: Many local families are struggling after years of Tory austerity.
Trafford has some of the worst funded schools in the country under the Tories.
The Tories have cut 20,000 police since 2010 and crime is rising locally as a result.
